Short form
(as you would cite this archive)

Enter the catalogue number to associate photos with a specific document in a catalogue.

When working with sequences such as entire collections it may be convenient to use the optional controls below to increment the final levels of the catalogue reference. E.g. books or letters. Non sequential entry of reference numbers may be easier using a single text field.

The character limit for filenames is accumulated across all input fields though is not restricted as you may have a valid reason for creating filenames that do not work in common file systems. Instead a warning message is shown when 128 characters is exceeded, this would be a really long file name. Actual limits vary for according to file system, but 255 characters is likely to work.
File name for the next photo:

1. Make sure to choose an archive.

2. Make sure to enter a reference for your archival record. It has to include min. 1 letter.

3. Separate hierarchy levels in archival records with \'_\' or \'/\'. Other separators cannot be used.

This app is a revised version of Capturing the Past. This app was originally developed in a research project at the Sussex Humanities Lab. The original project was funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council.

- Enter the full archive name and the short form as you would cite the archive.

- The short form will be part of the photo name:

BArch_DQ1_14614_1.jpg

- Enter the reference for the next record to photograph.

- The reference will be part of the photo name:

BArch_DQ1_14614_1.jpg

- The photo name ends with a counter. It increases as you take photos of the record.
Define folder structure via record name

- Add hierarchy levels using \"_\" or \"/\" in the record reference.

- BArch_DQ1_14614_1.jpg will result in:

- Take notes for the next photo you take.

- Press \"Take photo\" to open the camera.

- Saving the photo automatically saves your notes.

- Find your photos and notes in the menu (☰).
Use notes and photos on your computer

- You\'re done in the archive? Connect your phone to your computer.

- Access your phone\'s file system on your computer.

- Photos: > Pictures > cPast.

- Notes: > Documents > cPast.
Your notes are saved in cPast_Notes.csv in the Documents directory on your phone.
Name your photos after record references.
Sort your photos along the archive structure.
